name: ModuleCat.instHasLimitsOfSizeModuleCatMax
initialProofState:
R : Type u
inst✝ : Ring R
⊢ CategoryTheory.Limits.HasLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max v w, max (max (v + 1) (w + 1)) u} (ModuleCatMax R)
decl:
instance : HasLimitsOfSize.{v,v} (ModuleCatMax.{v, w} R) :=
  ModuleCat.hasLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max v w}

/- We need to put this in this weird spot because we need to know that the category of modules
    is balanced. -/

name: ModuleCat.forget_reflectsLimitsOfSize
initialProofState:
R : Type u
inst✝ : Ring R
⊢ CategoryTheory.Limits.ReflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max v w, max v w, max (max u (v + 1)) (w + 1), max (v + 1) (w + 1)} (CategoryTheory.forget (ModuleCatMax R))
decl:
instance forget_reflectsLimitsOfSize :
    ReflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v} (forget (ModuleCatMax.{v, w} R)) :=
  reflectsLimits_of_reflectsIsomorphisms

name: ModuleCat.forget₂_reflectsLimitsOfSize
initialProofState:
R : Type u
inst✝ : Ring R
⊢ CategoryTheory.Limits.ReflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max v w, max v w, max (max u (v + 1)) (w + 1), max (v + 1) (w + 1)} (CategoryTheory.forget₂ (ModuleCatMax R) AddCommGrp)
decl:
instance forget₂_reflectsLimitsOfSize :
    ReflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v} (forget₂ (ModuleCatMax.{v, w} R) AddCommGrp.{max v w}) :=
  reflectsLimits_of_reflectsIsomorphisms

name: ModuleCat.forget_reflectsLimits
initialProofState:
R : Type u
inst✝ : Ring R
⊢ CategoryTheory.Limits.ReflectsLimits (CategoryTheory.forget (ModuleCat R))
decl:
instance forget_reflectsLimits : ReflectsLimits (forget (ModuleCat.{v} R)) :=
  ModuleCat.forget_reflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v}

name: ModuleCat.forget₂_reflectsLimits
initialProofState:
R : Type u
inst✝ : Ring R
⊢ CategoryTheory.Limits.ReflectsLimits (CategoryTheory.forget₂ (ModuleCat R) AddCommGrp)
decl:
instance forget₂_reflectsLimits : ReflectsLimits (forget₂ (ModuleCat.{v} R) AddCommGrp.{v}) :=
  ModuleCat.forget₂_reflectsLimitsOfSize.{v, v}
